Safety: No DSB; minimal indels or translocations. CBEs may induce bystander or RNA off-target edits
Delivery Constraints: Dual-AAV or lentivirus, LNPs, RNP electroporation, plasmid
References: Hołubowicz, R., Du, S.W., Felgner, J. et al. Safer and efficient base editing and prime editing via ribonucleoproteins delivered through optimized lipid-nanoparticle formulations. (2025)

Safety: No DSB; precise edits with few indels. Off-target profiles still under investigation
References: Hołubowicz, R., Du, S.W., Felgner, J. et al. Safer and efficient base editing and prime editing via ribonucleoproteins delivered through optimized lipid-nanoparticle formulations. (2025)

Safety: High genotoxic risk from DSBs. Prolonged expression (e.g. via AAV) can accumulate off-targets
Delivery Constraints: RNP electroporation, plasmid transfection, viral vectors (AAV, lentivirus), LNPs
References: Slaman, E., Kottenhagen, L., de Martines, W. et al. Comparison of Cas12a and Cas9-mediated mutagenesis in tomato cells. (2024)

Safety: No DSB; highly specific binding, possible off-targets
Delivery Constraints: Plasmid transfection, lentiviral/retroviral vectors for stable expression, RNP, AAV
References: Cai, R.; Lv, R.; Shi, X.; Yang, G.; Jin, J. CRISPR/dCas9 Tools: Epigenetic Mechanism and Application in Gene Transcriptional Regulation. (2023)
